c is answer

choices.D: Just prior to the handover to the system maintenance group

questions.question_text: When is the BEST time to commence continuity planning for a new application system?

choices.B: Increased number of incidents reviewed by IT management
choices.D: Increased number of reported critical incidents
choices.A: Decreased number of calls to the help desk

discussion.content:
The effectiveness of an incident management process can be measured by the ability to resolve incidents quickly and efficiently. A decrease in incident resolution time indicates that the process is working effectively, as appropriate actions are being taken to identify, analyze, and resolve incidents in a timely manner.

A shorter resolution time means that the proper procedures are in place to deal with incidents efficiently, which in turn can lead to less disruption to services and higher user satisfaction.

While other options can provide useful information about the overall performance of the incident handling process, the decrease in incident resolution time is a more direct indicator of the effectiveness and efficiency of the incident handling process.
C for charlie
Answer: C. Decreased time for incident resolution.
Answer is C

Selected Answer: D
I could go wrong. Initially I chose D also, but after brainstorming, I found the term "critical" makes confusing. Incident management process is considered effective if ALL incidents are reported, regardless of criticality. Therefore, C stands out than D in this case in terms of effectiveness.

Selected Answer: C
This metric is often a key performance indicator (KPI) for incident management processes, reflecting their ability to restore services quickly and mitigate the impact of incidents.

Selected Answer: C
Answer: C

Selected Answer: D
my answer is D

My answer is D. The effectiveness of an incident management processes is dependent on the identification of critical incidence. If critical events are not identified and reported, than a low resolution time is useless

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST indicates that an incident management process is effective?
Prior to the migration of acquired software into production, it is MOST important that the IS auditor review the:

discussion.content: A. user acceptance test report. UAT is critical, Escrow agreement serves a different purpose and can be done after migration.

comments.content: I got it now. YOU are CORRECT.
You are confusing us. You are saying the answer is system documentation then landing to UAT report.
System documentation (C) is not the same as system testing so UAT (A) is the Answer

discussion.content:
From CISA Review Manual 27th edition, Chapter 3, PART B: INFORMATION SYSTEMS IMPLEMENTATION:
Information systems implementation is when the system is installed and moved into the production environment after appropriate system and usersâ€™ acceptance testing.
Answer (C) is System documentation not System testing, so correct the answer is A. user acceptance test report.

Selected Answer: A
a is correct

The primary function of an IS auditor is to determine how the organization should respond to risks that are specific to their operation and then evaluate whether the response is appropriate based on auditing standards and best practices.

Options A, B, and C: All are addressing the technical and business requirements of the project.
Option D: The source code escrow agreement is to address the associated risk to the project investment.

So, Option D is the correct answer.
C is the correct answer

comments.content: Answer (C) is System documentation not System testing, so correct the answer is A. user acceptance test report.

discussion.content: should be documentation, since software has been already acquired then whats the relation with Escrow. Since it is prior to migration then concerns should be UAT & DOCUMENTATION

Selected Answer: B
Because insiders have intimate knowledge of the organization's operations, processes, policies, and vulnerabilities, the greatest damage can be done if they are exploited.
B. Insider attack

questions.question_text: Which type of attack poses the GREATEST risk to an organization's most sensitive data?

choices.D: Employee-access criteria determined on the basis of IS experience
choices.B: Initial escort of all new hires by a current employee
choices.C: Periodic review of access profiles by management
choices.A: Physical sign-in of all employees for access to restricted areas

questions.question_text: Using swipe cards to limit employee access to restricted areas requires implementing which additional control?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Using swipe cards to limit employee access to restricted areas requires implementing periodic review of access profiles by management. This ensures that only authorized individuals have access to restricted areas and that any changes in employees' roles or responsibilities are reflected in their access permissions.

Selected Answer: C
It is advisable to periodically review physical access controls that store and transmit information about the swipe cardholder's identity and access rights.
It is not B because not only new hires are threat agents. Old hires are also threat agents

Selected Answer: C
This is because swipe cards can be lost, stolen, or misused by unauthorized persons, so management needs to review the access profiles periodically to ensure that only authorized persons have access to restricted areas. This is also a good practice for security and compliance reasons.

Selected Answer: B
Yes is B
